Note:
Edition from unidentified source is Clermont (1869)
XClermont, Thomas Fortescue, baron. The Works of Sir John Fortescue, Knight. 2 vols. London, 1869, 1.543.
Title(s): ‘Twelve points for purchasers of land to look to’
_description: ‘Twelve points for purchasers of land to look to’, sometimes attributed to Sir John Fortescue — ten or twelve couplets

BodAsh61.First Lines:
Who so wyll be were in purchasyngConsider þe poyntes þat
                    be þer Inne…
BodAsh61.Last Lines:
…And in x ȝere if þou wyse beThou shall a geyn
                    þi money se
BodAsh61.Editions:
Shuffleton,  George. 
             Ashmole 61: A Compilation of Popular Middle English Verse.
         Kalamazoo, MI: Western Michigan University for TEAMS, 2008: 70-1; 448-51; 602.

BodDou54.First Lines:
Who so wilbe wise in purchasingeconsyder þe poyntes þat
                    ben followinge…
BodDou54.Last Lines:
…& in xiiij yeare yf thow wysse areþou shalte agayne
                    thy money see

BodLatMisC66.First Lines:
Who so will be wise in purchasyngeConsidre the poyntis þat byn
                    suynge…
BodLatMisC66.Last Lines:
…& if thou a wise purcheser beIn x yere day thou shalt a
                    gayn the money see

                    see

                    folowyng…

BLAdd6702.First Lines:
Who so wylbe ware of purchasingeconsider these poyntes
                    folow[inge]…
BLAdd6702.Last Lines:
…In fyftene yeres yf thou wyse beAgayne thou shalt thy money
                    see
BLAdd6702.Note: 22 lines, written two lines of verse per line in the MS.
BLAdd6702.Attributed Title: Certeyn verses to be taken heed of Every purch[aser] (f. 109)

BLAdd25001.First Lines:
Who so will be ware of purchasingconsider theise points that be
                    following…
BLAdd25001.Last Lines:
…In xv yeares if thou wise beagaine thou shalt thy mony
                    see

BLLan762.First Lines:
Who wolbe ware in purchasingConcidre the poyntes that been
                    folowing…
BLLan762.Last Lines:

                    see& so þat the seller that therof seased beStonde not
                    owtelawed in maner degre

BLRoy17Bxlvii.First Lines:
Ihesu as thou art heuen kyngSende vs grace to haue knowyngWho
                    wille be warre in purchasyngConsidre the poyntes here
                    folowyng…
BLRoy17Bxlvii.Last Lines:
…In xv yere if ye wise beYe shalle ayein your money
                    see

CantB2.First Lines:
Whoo will be ware in purchesyngConsider the poyntes that be
                    folowyng…
CantB2.Last Lines:
…In xv yere if thou wise bethou shalt ageyne thy money
                    seSe whether the tenure be bonde or freAnd se a release of euery
                    feoffe
CantB2.Note:
Account book of St Augustine’s Abbey, c. 1519; 24 lines
                    including added last couplet.
CantB2.Editions:
DuBoulay,  F. R. H. 
             “The Lordship of Canterbury: An Essay on Medieval Society.” 
         London: Nelson, 1966: 158.
